content.text:
# San Diego Film Critics Society Award for Best Performance by an Ensemble

The San Diego Film Critics Society Award for Best Performance by an Ensemble (formerly for Best Cast) is an annual film award given by the San Diego Film Critics Society.
Winners
2000s
{| class="wikitable" width="95%" cellpadding="5"
|-
!width="10%"|Year
!width="30%"|Winner
!width="60%"|Cast members
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 2006 ||Babel||Adriana Barraza, Cate Blanchett, Gael García Bernal, Rinko Kikuchi, Brad Pitt, and Kōji Yakusho
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 2007 ||No Country for Old Men||Javier Bardem, Josh Brolin, Garret Dillahunt, Tess Harper, Woody Harrelson, Tommy Lee Jones, and Kelly Macdonald
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 2008 ||Frost/Nixon||Kevin Bacon, Rebecca Hall, Toby Jones, Frank Langella, Matthew Macfadyen, Oliver Platt, Sam Rockwell, and Michael Sheen
|-
|style="text-align:center;"| 2009 ||Inglourious Basterds|| Daniel Brühl, August Diehl, Julie Dreyfus, Michael Fassbender, Sylvester Groth, Jacky Ido, Diane Kruger, Mélanie Laurent, Denis Menochet, Mike Myers, Brad Pitt, Eli Roth, Til Schweiger, Rod Taylor, Christoph Waltz, and Martin Wuttke
|}

|style="text-align:center;"| 2015 ||What We Do in the Shadows||Jemaine Clement, Rhys Darby, and Taika Waititi
